intro: Pararuellia delavayana, commonly known as the Delavay's pararuellia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, while its flowers are often white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
